description: Sample curriculum goals and knowledge components for Cambridge Primary Mathematics

goals.title: Count, read and write numbers to 1000
goals.description: Students can count in steps of different sizes, read and write numbers to 1000 in numerals and words.
goals.subject: Mathematics

knowledge_components.description: Ability to count in steps of 2s, 5s, 10s, 25s, 50s, and 100s
Recognition and reading of numerals from 1 to 1000
Reading and writing numbers in word form up to 1000
Understanding the value of digits in hundreds, tens, and units places

goals.title: Order and compare numbers to 1000
goals.description: Students can order and compare numbers to 1000 using mathematical symbols.
goals.subject: Mathematics

knowledge_components.description: Comparing numbers using >, <, and = symbols
Arranging numbers in ascending and descending order
Using place value knowledge to compare numbers

goals.title: Add and subtract numbers to 1000
goals.description: Students can add and subtract numbers to 1000 using different methods.
goals.subject: Mathematics

knowledge_components.description: Using mental strategies for addition including near doubles and bridging
Using mental strategies for subtraction including counting on and back
Formal written method for addition with carrying
Formal written method for subtraction with borrowing

goals.title: Count, read and write numbers to 10000
goals.description: Students can count in steps of different sizes, read and write numbers to 10000 in numerals and words.
goals.subject: Mathematics

knowledge_components.description: Counting in steps including 3s, 4s, 6s, 7s, 8s, 9s, and 1000s
Recognition and reading of numerals from 1 to 10000
Understanding the value of digits in thousands, hundreds, tens, and units
Rounding numbers to the nearest 10, 100, and 1000

goals.title: Understand and use fractions
goals.description: Students understand fractions as parts of a whole and can perform basic operations with fractions.
goals.subject: Mathematics

knowledge_components.description: Understanding fractions as parts of a whole or set
Finding and using equivalent fractions
Comparing fractions with the same denominator
Understanding and converting between improper fractions and mixed numbers

goals.title: Multiply and divide by single digits
goals.description: Students can multiply and divide numbers by single digit numbers using various methods.
goals.subject: Mathematics

knowledge_components.description: Recall of multiplication facts up to 12 Ã— 12
Grid method, long multiplication, and other strategies
Short division and chunking methods
Finding and interpreting remainders in division

goals.title: Work with numbers to 1000000
goals.description: Students can read, write, order and round whole numbers to 1000000.
goals.subject: Mathematics

knowledge_components.description: Reading and writing numbers up to 1 million
Understanding place value in 6-digit numbers
Rounding to nearest 10, 100, 1000, 10000, and 100000
Understanding and using negative numbers in context

goals.title: Calculate with decimals
goals.description: Students can understand decimal notation and perform calculations with decimal numbers.
goals.subject: Mathematics

knowledge_components.description: Understanding tenths and hundredths place values
Ordering and comparing decimal numbers
Adding decimal numbers with same number of decimal places
Subtracting decimal numbers with same number of decimal places

goals.title: Advanced multiplication and division
goals.description: Students can multiply and divide larger numbers including decimals.
goals.subject: Mathematics

knowledge_components.description: Multiplying 3-digit by 2-digit numbers
Dividing 4-digit by 2-digit numbers
Multiplying decimal numbers by whole numbers
Dividing decimal numbers by whole numbers
